repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Innovations in Basic Education
            Project, the Second and Third NortheastBasic Education
            Projects, and the School Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the FUNDESCOLA project is
            rated satisfactory. The outcomes of the Innovations in Basic
            Education and Northeast Basic Education (NEBE) projects are
            rated moderately satisfactory. The projects exceeded or
            surpassed most targets for physical inputs and training but
            it is not clear that the learning goals were met. The
            objectives of the two NEBE projects were focused towards
            central management improvements, and these had little or no
            impact on quality improvement. Due to design shortcomings,
            Bank performance for the FUNDESCOLA project, which was
            designed to target schools, was satisfactory. Borrower
            performance is rated satisfactory for all but the
            Innovations in Education project. A number of OED lessons
            are confirmed with these projects: 1) Attention should be
            paid to state, municipal, or even school management, and
            moreover, to classromm time. States and municipalities that
            are better off are more likely to take advantage of
            Bank-financed resources. The challenge is to emcourage the
            poorer ones to benefit as well. Decentralizing school
            managmeent is not a panacea: autonomy permits the poorest or
            least knowledgeable municipalities to fall behind, without
            much possibility for helping the residents. Classroom
            observations may be used as predictors of achievement: they
            can potentially provide feedback and promote improvements
            sooner than achievement tests. Students' health needs
            and problems must be addressed to optimize cognitive
            development and classroom learning.

1960913.trustfund:
TF035276-BRAZIL - EDUCATION SECTOR,TF025482-PHRD -HUMAN CAPITAL DEVELOPMENT PORTFOLIO,TF027360-SCIENCE RESEARCG AND TRAINING PROJECT,TF027370-NORTHEAST BASIC EDUCATION,TF034238-BRAZIL - TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Second Northeast Basic Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Northeast Basic Education
            Project's overall outcome is rated satisfactory. While
            overall learning levels in the Northeast still lag behind
            those of much of the country, some progress has been made in
            closing the achievement gap between Northeast students and
            their counterparts in other regions. The lessons drawn from
            this project include: a) Targets and goals in project design
            that are operational and relevant to components, objectives,
            and outputs are important. b) Delays in implementation can
            partially be attributed on the lack of a unified, coherent,
            and detailed implementation plan. c) There is the need for
            bottom-up policies to get directly at improving schools and
            reaching schools and municipalities. Coordinating a package
            of improvements, including teacher training, school
            rehabilitation, or textbooks, is important to improving
            student learning. d) The project paid substantial attention
            to including input from the users in developing and
            designing the management information system. Political will,
            product "marketing", and incentives for use are
            necessary for a system to be adopted. e) Full knowledge of
            Bank processes and practice could make product people more
            aware of the steps necessary to complete the Bank's
            complex procedures and encourage them to turn in necessary
            documentation on time. f) Strong monitoring and evaluation
            systems are important to project success.

5079429.trustfund:
TF034238-BRAZIL - TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
            IN PROCUREMENT TRAINING AND REVIEW,TF027370-NORTHEAST BASIC EDUCATION

repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Second Northeast Basic Education Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's objectives are to
            increase student learning, reduce repetition and dropout,
            and increase graduation rates in the four states through
            improvements in the quality of state and municipal primary
            education and in the efficiency of education management.  At
            the state level, the project will:  (a) streamline state
            education bureaucracies and help them achieve more efficient
            use of human resources and a more efficient allocation of
            spending; (b) increase state and municipal materials; (c)
            improve state and municipal teachers' skills and
            classroom effectiveness and the leadership skills of school
            directors; (d) finance a time slice of the states'
            school rehabilitation and construction programs, conditional
            upon states' progress in implementing agreed management
            reforms; and (e) support promising state and municipal
            education initiatives through matching grants from a small
            innovations fund.  The project will also have a component at
            the federal level to strengthen the Ministry of
            Education's capacity for key oversight and support
            functions, such as national standardized student testing;
            planning, policy and norm-setting; and financial transfers
            to equalize education spending across states.  Finally, the
            project will support reform of the centralized national
            textbook and school lunch distribution systems, in order to
            assure the timely and adequate availability of learning
            materials in Brazilian primary schools.

The project's objectives are to
            increase student learning, reduce repetition and dropout,
            and increase graduation rates in the four states through
            improvements in the quality of state and municipal primary
            education and in the efficiency of education management.  At
            the state level, the project will:  (a) streamline state
            education bureaucracies and help them achieve more efficient
            use of human resources and a more efficient allocation of
            spending; (b) increase state and municipal materials; (c)
            improve state and municipal teachers' skills and
            classroom effectiveness and the leadership skills of school
            directors; (d) finance a time slice of the states'
            school rehabilitation and construction programs, conditional

            reforms; and (e) support promising state and municipal

            to equalize education spending across states.  Finally, the
            project will support reform of the centralized national
            textbook and school lunch distribution systems, in order to
            assure the timely and adequate availability of learning
            materials in Brazilian primary schools.
